page.title: 04EDUCATION, ST. MERRYN SCHOOL
page.content: This is a small village school.The main buildings,built in 1876 are joined on to a headteacher's house.The headteacher does not live there any more. There are four classrooms today for children from 5-11 years. At 11 years the children transfer to Wadebridge School until 16 years. Classes 1 and 2 are modern buildings. Classes 3 and 4 are the original building which is 109 years old. The school has got a field we use it for . Football ,cricket ,running ,athletics, rounders and for playing. The playground is used for netball and basketball. The school looks very old from the outside but inside it is very upto date with three T.V,s ,a video, a BBC computer,two phones and a photocopier.
